main_definition: Reduced to Rent Price (RTP) is a term used in the real estate industry to denote the minimum rent that can be charged for leasing a property, taking into consideration factors such as location, size, and condition.

meanings_and_examples.example: The landlord decided to reduce the rental price of his commercial property due to a decrease in demand.
To attract more tenants, some real estate companies offer discounted rental rates for their properties.
The apartment complex reduced the lease prices to make it more affordable and competitive in the market.
